title: 91/204/EEC: Commission Decision of 11 March 1991 on the establishment of the Community support framework for Community structural assistance on the improvement of the conditions under which fishery and aquaculture products are processed and marketed in the Netherlands (Only the Dutch text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 11 March 1991 on the establishment of the Community support framework for Community structural assistance on the improvement of the conditions under which fishery and aquaculture products are processed and marketed in the  Netherlands (Only the Dutch text is authentic) (91/204/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Article 1 The Community support framework for Community structural assistance on the improvement of the conditions under which fishery and aquaculture products are processed and marketed in the Netherlands, covering the period 1 January 1991 to 31  December 1993, is hereby approved.
The Commission declares that it intends to contribute to the implementation of this Community support framework in accordance with the detailed provisions thereof and in compliance with the rules and guidelines of the Structural Funds and the other  existing financial instruments.  Article 2 The Community support framework contains the following essential information:
(a)  a statement of the main priorities for joint action:
1.  processing of fishery and aquaculture products;
2.  marketing of fishery and aquaculture products;
(b)
an indicative financing plan specifying, at constant 1991 prices, the total cost of the priorities adopted for joint action by the Community and the Member State concerned, ECU 26,000 million for the whole period, and the financial arrangements  envisaged for budgetary assistance from the Community, broken down as follows:
(million ECU)
(a)
1.  Processing of fishery and aquaculture
products
4,420
2.  Marketing of fishery and aquaculture
products
0,780
The resultant national financing requirement, approximately ECU 1,300 million for the public sector and ECU 19,500 million for the private sector, may be partially
covered by Community loans from the European Investment Bank and the other loan instruments.  Article 3 This declaration of intent is addressed to the Kingdom of the Netherlands.
